title: Define the Domain
text: A rational function is undefined when the denominator is equal to zero. So, let's start by setting the denominator equal to zero. In addition, this function also contains a square root in the numerator which is undefined when the expression under the square root is negative, so we can set the numerator greater than or equal to zero.

subHints.title: Solving For the Denominator
subHints.text: For $$x-4=0$$, add $$4$$ to both sides, and $$x=4$$.

subHints.title: Solving For the Numerator
subHints.text: Set the expression under the numerator greater than or equal to $$0$$, and subtract $$4$$ to both sides. $$x \geq -4$$.

title: Answer
text: So, the function is defined for every value greater than or equal to $$-4$$ other than 4.The domain of the function is $$[-4,4) \cup (4,\infty)$$, with the circle brackets denoting the fact that $$4$$ is not a valid solution, and the U showing that values within the intervals are solutions.
